item.title: Report X-2024020866
item.description:
Report X-2024020866

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking during preload. Pkg may have not been facing with orientation arrows upwards The area was temporarily evacuated and absorbent mats was used to clean up the spill. At discovery, the pkg was immediately taken to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Leaking from top of can. No clips seen. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package handlers were told what to do when a hazmat leaks. They were retaught how to properly load hazmats with orientation arrows upwards. Absorbent mats were used for cleanup.

  • Description: When employees went to attach hoses to bottom connection and they undid the cap for the bottom valve about a quart of liquid came out. The tanker was in containment and no material went off site. The spill was able to be cleaned in house. It was discovered that the internal valve wasn't fully closed and that was the cause of the leak. The trailer was then sent to be inspected also before use again.

item.title: Report X-2024020902
item.description:
Report X-2024020902

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A smoking non-spillable battery was found with a punctured fiberboard box and battery casing on the flexslide around 4pm. The carton was placed in a lined tote and bought to the HWPA where it was placed under the vent and watched until it cooled down. DescribePack: The battery was leaking and smoking from a hole in its side and appears to have shorted. No terminal covers or inner packaging were found. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The battery was carefully placed in a lined tote and brought to the HWPA, where it was placed under the ventilation hood and observed. Proper PPE was worn.

item.title: Report X-2024021039
item.description:
Report X-2024021039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It appears tape failed on the bottom of packaging. While unloading the package bottom opened up causing inner contents fall out. (1) plastic Gallon bottle of Lime-B-Gone landed with cap side down causing it to crack and spill some contents. QA was notified and removed package to Hazmat cage utilizing all appropriate PPE to include, Gloves, goggles and face mask. DescribePack: Tape on the bottom of the package gave way under the weight of items causing one of the bottles to fall on the cap causing it to crack DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was immediately picked up and placed upright to minimize amount of spillage.

item.title: Report E-2024020337
item.description:
Report E-2024020337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the absorbents used by the terminal staff and deployed more as needed to the dock, trailer, and pavement surfaces. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon salvage drum for disposal. All impacted absorbents and solid waste was collected and contianerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. FCE remediated staining on the dock floor and pavement to the extent practicable with paint thinner and acetone. Both waste drums were labeled and staged onsite.

  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of corrosive liquid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive liquid-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024020947

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING UNLOADED AND APPARENTLY PLACED ON THE BELT AND THERE WAS VISIBLE DAMAGE. PKG WAS QUICKLY SECURED IN A YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM AND SEALED DUE TO THE STRONG ODOR OF THE CONTENTS. PKG WAS LATER INVESTIGATED AT THE QA DAMAGE TABLE AFTER THE SORT. DescribePack: MISHANDLING AND TOO MUCH REHANDLE WAS THE CAUSE. PKG HAS BEEN RECYCLING FOR 2 WEEKS BACK AND FORTH FROM THE SHIPPER DUE TO IMPORPER PAPERWORK. BOTTLE INSIDE WAS GLASS SO IT WAS EITHER DROPPED OR THROWN ONTO THE BELT, CAUSING IT TO BREAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ENTIRE PKG WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUM AND SEALED AND SECURED AWAY FROM STATION EMPLOYEE.

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XSL contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred on the dock in St. Louis, MO. The spill consisted of approximately 2-gallons of UN1268 Rikeizai SBS-A02, which was released from a 275-gallon metal tote due to a forklift blade damaging the lid. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they were comfortable to clean the spill themselves with PPE available onsite. All impacted absorbents from cleanup were containerized into (2) 20-gallon metal drums. The shipper sent terminal personnel a replacement lid which was secured onto the tote by terminal personnel and the tote was shipped on.

item.title: Report E-2024020296
item.description:
Report E-2024020296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a release UN3266 Mainline Liquid 102 from a 250-gallon poly tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of material released to a 12’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot underneath the trailer due to a pinhole puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Citric acid solution and absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all spent absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020268
item.description:
Report E-2024020268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: CARNEGIE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/12/2024, I john Vergis Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE, was called by the WLE Car Shop Manager @0730 hrs. about tank car UTLX 205661 leaking in the WLE Rook Yard. When I arrived to look at the car, I could see that is was leaking product from the protective housing on top the car. I got on top the car and removed seal number 451443 from the protective housing cover and noticed that product was leaking from the Sample Line Valve. Product was leaking from the valve plug. I checked to see of the valve handle was shut and it was not tight. I turned the valve handle one complete turn before it was shut tight. I then checked to see if the valve plug was loose and when I touched the plug, it fell out. I installed new thread sealant on the plug and installed it in the valve and tightened it tool tight. I then cleaned off the top and sides of the car the best I could. I installed new seal number 0000225 on the protective housing lid and then released the car back into transportation.

  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to a broken pallet puncturing one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. First Call Environmental personnel removed all freight from the trailer and then neutralized the impacted area. The spent material was recovered and placed into one 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged 55-gallon poly drum with the remaining product was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 5, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was damaged in transit due to unknown causes and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel collected one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of UN3098 for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and pavement and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, FCE personnel utilized a neutralizing agent and absorbent pads to collect all residual product. All UN3098 impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums that were staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • City: GEORGETOWN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA from unload in a tote with contents leaking from the outside. I realized it was a damage Hazmat and took it to the Hazmat Cage to start processing. DescribePack: Box was ripped from the opening, down the side to the bottom. Hydrogen Peroxide and Peroxyacetic Acid mixture stabilized, 5.1 (8), 11, 3.781, Oxidizer Corrosive inside of a plastic bag that was leaking contents. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a hazardous materials bag inside a yellow drum. I used the chemical neutralizer on the visible spilled liquid. This is a Class 8 liquid, so I confirmed neutralization using the PH test. Levels were between 6-9, at 8. Once there was no heat and had cooled down, I placed the fiberboard box in the drum and secured the bag with a zip tie. Drum is sealed and waiting to be picked up by authorized personnel.

I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP LEAKED FROM ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. X-2024020785-SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND RIPPED. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK THE PRODUCTS INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 3 LITERS LEAKED OUT FROM PART B DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: ONE OF FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 3 LITERS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER.

item.title: Report I-2024020014
item.description:
Report I-2024020014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: DFW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A package was tendered by forwarder DHL to Qatar Airways in DFW under MAWB 157-89110081 declared as consolidation. Actual contents were medical equipment and accessories per HAWB description which contained lithium ion batteries. It was not booked as an ELI shipment as it was supposed to but had an ELI label and PSN written on package. Upon acceptance and build up GHA where house staff failed to notice the ELI label and the PSN. As a result it was manifested and forwarded as general cargo on flight QR730/24Jan DFWDOH. Upon arrival of flight in Doha, it was discovered as a undeclared battery shipment. Shipment was held in Doha until proper documents were furnished to match package contents and labeling. Report filed with local CAA.

DescribePack: Caps on top of bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box, hazmat and all cleaning supplies were placed in hazmat bag and salvage drum.

  • Description: Landstar contracted ERTSr to request help with a spill inside of a trailer at First Source Worldwide, located at 413 Virgil Dr. in Dalton, GA. The spill consists of approximately 3 cups of UN1797 Ammonium bifluoride, solid (trade name unknown), which released from a torn 55 pound paper bag. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors were informed that 3 cups of AMMONIUM HYDROGEN DIFLUORIDE SOLID (UN1727, 8, II) was released from (1) 55-pound bag. Facility personnel cleaned the release and will manage all waste generated.

  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER CALLED TO METRO 2 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE WITH A STRONG ODOR. UPON ARRIVAL WEARING HAZMAT PPE, CHECKED THE PH LEVEL AND FOLLOWED THE RESPONDER'S DECISION TREE. PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE FOR TRANSPORT BACK THE HAZMAT CAGE. FURTHER INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE LABEL (INGREDIENTS LISTED, "FLAMMABLE", ODOR), LACKING SHIPPING PAPERS, UNABLE TO PULL AN SDS OR COMPANY INFO - DETEREMINED THIS IS A POTENTIAL UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE. CONTATCTED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK TO REPORT AND VERIFY.

  • Description: RMP BROUGHT OVER A PACKAGE TO THE PSC. IT WAS DETERMINED THE PACKAGE WAS POSSIBLY AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT BECAUSE INSIDE THE BOX WAS A BUCKET WITH A LIMITED QUANTITY STICKER, BUT THERE WAS NO LIMITED QUANTITY STICKER ON THE EXTERNAL PACKAGING. RESPONDER CALLED HMSC WHO CONFIRMED IT WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. PUT ON HOLD FOR ADG COMPLIANCE. POLYAMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. PART B - ENVIRONMENTALLY HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES, LIQUID PART A (NOT REGULATED NON BULK)

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE SIDE OF THE BOX WAS REALLY DIRTY AND WET. THE MANAGER IMMEDICATELY TOOK SAID PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY, SECURELY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT OF ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES DUE TO THE BOTTLE HAVING A LOOSE CAP. IT LEAKED FROM THE PART A RAPICIDE BOTTLE. THE OTHER 3 BOTTLES WERE FINE, JUST A LITTLE WET FROM THE ALREADY LEAKAGE. DescribePack: THERE WERE 4 BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE. TWO OF THE PART A SOLUTION AND TWO OF THE PART B SOLUTION. ONE OF THE BOTTLES FROM THE PART A SOLUTION HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE MANAGER TAKING THE PACKAGE IMMEDIATELY OVER THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE PROPERLY AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO SAFELY REPACK THE PRODUCT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking, removed from sortation, and brought to QA. DescribePack: Jug of herbicide was sideways in box, there was not enough room for it to be right side up in the box so we may conclude it was shipped sideways. Cap was taped shut but was also directly against the side of the box with no padding. While paper inner packing was included it was only to either side of the jug. Inspection revealed jug was leaking from the cap, which did not appear to be loose. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed right side up in a lined spill bin and brought to appropriate damage processing area. However being right side up surely did not help and jug was sideways in box, though this fact was not known at the time.

  • Description: On Jan 30th during the PM sort a pox was found leaking a white liquid substance. The package was not marked or labeled as dangerous goods. Upon opening the package two 1qt cans were found with one of them having leaked due to the lid coming off. Research into the product along with it being a PartA/PartB cand, as well as SDS from the MFG with similar part numbers leads us to believe this is a DG shipment. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being held for disposition.

RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECSION TREE GUIDLINES AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK LEAKER WITH AFFECTED BOXES TO THE DMP. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF. 2. X-2024020058 LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH THE CLEAN UP. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDLINES IN THE DECSION TREE WHILE CLEANING UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. 3. X-2024020059 LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING DECSION TREE GUIDELINES. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OFF.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: Petersburg
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1/5/24 at approximately 10:00 AM, Operators were loading ethanol from railcar MUI-X 730192 into Petroleum Carriers trailer 9301. While loading a scheduled 1400 gallons into compartment 2(capacity 2500 gallons), product was released from the overflow tubes at the rear of the trailer. The pump meter read 1272 gallons at the time of the release. An estimated 100 gallons impacted the asphalt. Product evaporated, there is no cleanup material to be disposed of. All appropriate personnel were notified of the incident. Overfill protection on the pump was disabled by the loaders. Driver failed to advise loaders that there was product remaining in the compartment being loaded.

item.title: Report E-2024020243
item.description:
Report E-2024020243

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While offloading the trailer, a Veolia employee moved a drum inside a trailer by hand in order to align the drums so that he could grab the drums with drum grabber more easily. When he began to tilt one of the metal drums, he noticed that it was leaking from the bottom. He pushed the drum to its side to identify the leak and noticed multiple pin holes where material was leaking from. Due to the weight of the drum, the employee was unable to flip the drum by himself and sought assistance. With help, they were able to flipped the drum upside down to prevent further release of material from the drum. Approximately 30 gallons leaked out of the drum and into the unloading dock containment area. The damaged drum along with the 9 other drums from the same shipment were placed into a salvage drum. The leaked liquid inside the trailer was absorbed and the liquid in the containment area was pumped out. The day before it was raining, so when the employee went inside of the trailer he did not see any visible signs of dripping or stains to show a possible leak. Nor did the employee see any abnormalities/ deficiencies to the drum before moving it. The actual duration of the spill is unknown however, Veolia believes that the spill occurred after the time of receiving into the facility since there was no evidence of any spill at our transfer location.

  • Description: See attached document: Exhibit 1 01.13.2024 Release Incident Timeline The 21 1/2" trailer dome lid was not secured. The dome lid is located top rear center of the trailer. The release began sometime between 0841 and 0847. The release concluded at 0858. The remediation completed at 2200. (estimated 13h 20m) A combination of dry sand and soda ash was spread over the release areas to neutralize the Sulfuric Acid. The debris was collected and placed in roll off containers for disposal.

  • Description: a spill was reported in Adelanto CA, due to improper loading at the previous terminal, a 50 LBS bag of phycomycin scp (UN3378) was damaged releasing 5 LBS of material into the trailer floor near the tail. ERTS obtained a product SDS and it was agreed that with proper PPE and procedures, it would be safe for the terminal to containerize the released material and the damaged bag for disposal. The terminal confined that the waste drum would be the product only with no other material. Only 1 bag will be held back. 5G DF - of Product only was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

  • City: HOUSTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30, 2024, one (1) 3-gallon pail of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged container in one (1) 55-gallon drum as waste. The crew then utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the site. All paint-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020008
item.description:
Report E-2024020008

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30th, 2024, at 1346 hours, personnel at the CSX Boyles Terminal in Birmingham, Alabama, reported a suspect odor from an inbound train. Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSX emergency response contractor, and Davy Ferguson, a CSX Manager of Hazardous Materials, responded to investigate. Upon investigation the area, response personnel discovered GATX 60194, a loaded tank car of Sulfur, Molten, was leaking vapor from the manway cover due to (1) of (6) manway cover bolts being less than tool tight. The car was isolated and the shipper, Contango Resources, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-01-30-00168). Response personnel properly secured the manway cover and stopped the release. The defect found and correction actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Ross Goff (307-840-1078).

item.title: Report E-2024010396
item.description:
Report E-2024010396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: SELKIRK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 01/16/24 at 08:55 hours, an FRA Hazardous Materials Inspector working in the CSX Selkirk Yard reported loaded tank car UTLX 209284, Alcohols NOS, leaking from the bottom outlet valve (BOV). The car was isolated and the shipper, Cargill, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0116-0040). HEPACO, a CSX Emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and confirmed the initial report of a leaking BOV. Upon further inspection, it was determined product was leaking past the internal ball of the BOV due to a defective component. It was also noted that due to a deteriorated gasket, the BOV’s secondary closure cap was unable to contain the leak. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper-s representative- Daniel Gernant (303-709-1653, Daniel_Gernant@cargill.com). Contractor personnel installed a new gasket on the secondary closure cap to contain stop the release. The car was held at Selkirk pending transload of the contents and certified repair and/or OTMA.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 20 gallons of diesel were released due to mechanical failure while offloading. The release impacted asphalt and concrete in a 34' x 43' and 20' x 4' area. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Absorbents were applied to the spill. Hepaco generated 2-55 gallon poly waste drums containing the absorbents used to clean the release and transported the waste off-site to their facility.
